availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Ripley, Ohio, laborer. Kentucky native. Son of George Bartley and Narcissa Bartley. Married Sarah E. Bartley. Laborer in Ripley in 1860. Convicted of grand larceny in the Mason Circuit Court in Maysville, Kentucky in August 1863. Imprisoned in the Kentucky State Penitentiary in Frankfort, Kentucky, from August 1863 to November 1863. Pardoned by Thomas E. Bramlette on November 5, 1863.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Brown County, Ripley post office, p. 3; KYR-0001-004-0035; KYR-0001-004-0038.
